question:
Which of the following was an important aspect of the Cripps mission of 1942?
(a)
All
Indian
state
should
join
the
Indian
union
as
a
condition to consider
degree of autonomy for India.
(b)
The
creation
of an
Indian
union
with
Dominion
status
very soon after the second world war:
(c)
The participation and co-operation of the Indian people
communities and political par- ties in the British war effort
as
a
condition for granting independence with full
sover-
 eign status to India after second world war:
(d)
The farming of a constitution for the entire Indian union
with no separate constitution for any province and a union
constitution to be accepted by all province:
Answer: (b)
choices:
(a)
All
Indian
state
should
join
the
Indian
union
as
a
condition to consider
degree of autonomy for India.
(b)
The
creation
of an
Indian
union
with
Dominion
status
very soon after the second world war:
(c)
The participation and co-operation of the Indian people
communities and political par- ties in the British war effort
as
a
condition for granting independence with full
sover-
 eign status to India after second world war:
(d)
The farming of a constitution for the entire Indian union
with no separate constitution for any province and a union
constitution to be accepted by all province:
topic: Nationalist Movement during the Second World War

question:
With reference to
August 1942 in Indian history, which one
of the following statements is correct?
(a)
The Quit India Resolution was adopted by the AICC
(b)
The
Viceroy's
Executive
Council
was
expanded
to
include more Indians:
(c)
The Congress ministries resigned in
seven
provinces:
(d)
Cripps proposed
an
Indian
Union
with full
Dominion
Status once the Second
World War was over:
Answer: (a)
choices:
(a)
The Quit India Resolution was adopted by the AICC
(b)
The
Viceroy's
Executive
Council
was
expanded
to
include more Indians:
(c)
The Congress ministries resigned in
seven
provinces:
(d)
Cripps proposed
an
Indian
Union
with full
Dominion
Status once the Second
World War was over:
topic: Nationalist Movement during the Second World War

question:
The plan of Sir Stafford Cripps envisaged that after the Second
World War:
(a)
India should be granted complete independence
(b)
India should be partitioned into two
before granting
independence
(c)
India should be
made
a
republic with
the condition
that she will join the Commonwealth
(d)
India should be given Dominion status
Answer: (d)
choices:
(a)
India should be granted complete independence
(b)
India should be partitioned into two
before granting
independence
(c)
India should be
made
a
republic with
the condition
that she will join the Commonwealth
(d)
India should be given Dominion status
topic: Nationalist Movement during the Second World War

question:
8th
Which of the following was/were the features of the Quit India
Movement?
1.From the very beginning, it was a rural revolt
2.It was
essentially a moderate movement
3.It was marked by the unprecedented use of violence
4.It was marked by acute state repression
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
a) 1 only
b) 1 and 2
c) 3 and 4 only
d)1,3 and 4
Answer: (c)
choices:
a) 1 only
b) 1 and 2
c) 3 and 4 only
d)1,3 and 4
topic: Nationalist Movement during the Second World War

question:
With reference to the proposals of Cripps Mission, consider the
following statements:
1. The Constituent Assembly would have members nominated
by the Provincial Assemblies as well as the Princely States:
2.
Province,
which
is
not prepared
to accept the
new
Constitution
would
have
the
right
to
sign
a
separate
agreement with Britain regarding its future status:
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a)
1
only
(b)
2 only
Both 1 and 2
(d)
Neither 1 nor 2
Answer: (b)
choices:
(a)
1
only
(b)
2 only
Both 1 and 2
(d)
Neither 1 nor 2
topic: Nationalist Movement during the Second World War

question:
Any
With
whom
did
Subhas
Chandra
Bose form
an
alliance
to
destroy the Holwel Monument in Calcutta during 1939-40?
a) The Communist Party of India
b) The Muslim League
c) The Hindu Mahasabha
d) The Unionist Party
Answer: (b)
choices:
a) The Communist Party of India
b) The Muslim League
c) The Hindu Mahasabha
d) The Unionist Party
topic: Nationalist Movement during the Second World War

of the Secret
Sitting Session of the Assembly (1942)?

 b) G. V: Mavalankar

 b) G. V: Mavalankar

question:
During the
freedom struggle,
Aruna
Asaf
Ali
was
a
major

underground activity
in

of the
following?
(a)
Civil Disobedience Movement
(b)
Non-Cooperation Movement
(c)
Quit India Movement
(d)
Swadeshi Movement

Non-Cooperation Movement

Quit India Movement
(d)
Swadeshi Movement

question:
Consider the following statements
After forming the Indian National Army, Subhas Chandra Bose
1,recruited
a
large
number
of
soldiers
from
the
Indian
Prisoners of War in Japanese camp
2.introduced a women's detachment named after the Rani of
Jhansi

a) 1 only
b)2 only
c) Both 1 and 2
d)Neither 1 nor 2
Answer: (c)
choices:
a) 1 only
b)2 only
c) Both 1 and 2
d)Neither 1 nor 2

question:
Which party was founded by Subhash Chandra Bose in the year
1939 after he broke away from the Congress?
(a)
Indian Freedom Party
(b)
Azad Hind Fauj
(c)
Revolutionary Front
(d)
Forward Bloc
Answer: (d)
choices:
(a)
Indian Freedom Party
(b)
Azad Hind Fauj
(c)
Revolutionary Front
(d)
Forward Bloc

question:
Which
one
of
the following
statements
about
the Cripps
Mission is not correct?
a) It
was sent to India by the
British
Government in
March
1942.
b)lt proposed that the Constitution of India was to be framed
by an elected Constituent Assembly of the Indian people:

province
which
was
not
prepared
to
accept
the
Constitution
would
be
free
to
retain
its
constitutional
provisions existing at that time:

British
Government
could
enter
into
a
separate
constitutional
arrangement
with
any
of
the
acceding
provinces
Answer: (d)
choices:
a) It
was sent to India by the
British
Government in
March
1942.
b)lt proposed that the Constitution of India was to be framed
by an elected Constituent Assembly of the Indian people:
C)
province
which
was
not
prepared
to
accept
the
Constitution
would
be
free
to
retain
its
constitutional
provisions existing at that time:
d) The
British
Government
could
enter
into
a
separate
constitutional
arrangement
with
any
of
the
acceding
provinces

question:
Any
Which one of the following statements about Cripps Mission is
NOT correct?
a)In March 1942, Cripps persuaded War Cabinet to agree to a
draft declaration
b)Jawaharlal Nehru and Sardar Patel represented Congress to
negotiate with the mission
c) The mission offered Dominion status after the war
d) The mission offered formation of constitution making body
after the war
Answer: (b)
choices:
a)In March 1942, Cripps persuaded War Cabinet to agree to a
draft declaration
b)Jawaharlal Nehru and Sardar Patel represented Congress to
negotiate with the mission
c) The mission offered Dominion status after the war
d) The mission offered formation of constitution making body
after the war
topic: Nationalist Movement during the Second World War

question:
The principle that the framing
of the
new
Constitution
for
independent India should be primarily (though not solely) the
responsibility of Indians themselves,
was
for the first time
conceded in the
a) Government of India Act, 1935
b)August Offer of Viceroy Linlithgow
c) Cripps Proposals
d)Cabinet Mission
Answer: (b)
choices:
a) Government of India Act, 1935
b)August Offer of Viceroy Linlithgow
c) Cripps Proposals
d)Cabinet Mission
topic: Nationalist Movement during the Second World War

question:
In 1943, young leaders in which one of the following districts
of Maharashtra set up
a
parallel Government (prati sarkar
with volunteer corps (seva dals) and village units (tufan dals)?
a) Pune
b) Nasik
C)
Nagpur
d) Satara
Answer: (d)
choices:
a) Pune
b) Nasik
C)
Nagpur
d) Satara

question:
Who among the following historians has described the Quit
India movement as a 'spontaneous revolution'?
a) Gordon Johnson
b)David Arnold

d)Peter Robb
Answer: (c)

a) Gordon Johnson
b)David Arnold
c) F G Hutchins
d)Peter Robb

question:

Quit India Movement of 1942?
(a)
It was a nonviolent movement
(b)
It was led by Mahatma Gandhi
It was a
spontaneous movement
(d)
It did not attract the labour class in general

It was a nonviolent movement
(b)
It was led by Mahatma Gandhi
It was a
spontaneous movement

It did not attract the labour class in general

of

question:

b)Austria

d)Malaysia

choices:

question:
Which one of the following was a
significant feature of the Quit
India Movement?
a) Women did not play an important role in the movement
b)Nasik in Maharashtra was an important regional base during
the movement
c) It was marked by anti-zamindar violence
d)It was marked by the emergence of parallel governments in
different parts of India
Answer: (d)
choices:
a) Women did not play an important role in the movement
b)Nasik in Maharashtra was an important regional base during
the movement
c) It was marked by anti-zamindar violence
d)It was marked by the emergence of parallel governments in
different parts of India
topic: Nationalist Movement during the Second World War
